creator: sbirl@temple.edu
text:
Sometimes the when I use the BACK button on Netscape 7, I recieve the following:
=================================================================================
Requested Range Not Satisfiable

None of the range-specifier values in the Range request-header field overlap the
current extent of the selected resource.
Apache/2.0.40 Server at ietf.org Port 80
=================================================================================

I have experienced this on my own Apache server 2.0.40 (Solaris 9).  I will
provide logs asap.

Do you have reason to believe this is a server error rather than a client error?

Can you capture the HTTP headers sent in the request to see if they are indeed
specifying an invalid range?  At minimum, adding %{Range}i to your LogFormat
string could help.
creator: slive@apache.org
sbirl@temple.edu
text:
Well I cannot do anything with the IETF server (http://ietf.org/rfc.html), since
I do not own it.

But I have done what was asked on my server (Solaris 9; Apache 2.0.40)
Problem URL:  http://concept.temple.edu/nUtNIX/

Resulting access_log (first line was initial connection, 2nd was a reload.)
155.247.27.153 - - [16/Oct/2002:12:56:51 +0500] "GET /nUtNIX/ HTTP/1.0" 200 1607 "-"
155.247.27.153 - - [16/Oct/2002:12:56:55 +0500] "GET /nUtNIX/ HTTP/1.0" 416 434
"bytes=2233-"

Nothing in error_log

Using AdSubtract Pro (proxy filter) I copied the headers:
(how do I go about getting Apache to supply the headers to Netscape?
 I guess the HEAD command.)
===============================================================================
   Host: concept.ocis.temple.edu
   User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.0.1)
Gecko/20020823 Netscape/7.0
   Accept:
text/xml,application/xml,application/xhtml+xml,text/html;q=0.9,text/plain;q=0.8,video/x-mng,image/png,image/jpeg,image/gif;q=0.2,text/css,*/*;q=0.1
   Accept-Language: en-us, en;q=0.85, en-au;q=0.71, en-ca;q=0.57, en-gb;q=0.42,
pt;q=0.28, it;q=0.14
   Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, compress;q=0.9
   Accept-Charset: ISO-8859-1, utf-8;q=0.66, *;q=0.66
   Keep-Alive: 300
   Proxy-Connection: keep-alive
Creating HtmlFilter for http://concept.ocis.temple.edu/nUtNIX/
   Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1
   Accept-Ranges: bytes
   Proxy-Connection: close
   Content-Length: 2236
   Server: Apache/2.0.40 (Unix) mod_ssl/2.0.40 OpenSSL/0.9.6g
   Last-Modified: Thu, 15 Nov 2001 20:46:28 GMT
   Etag: "2b221-647-6062b100"
   Date: Wed, 16 Oct 2002 07:56:51 GMT
   Connection: close
   Host: concept.ocis.temple.edu
   User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.0.1)
Gecko/20020823 Netscape/7.0
   Accept:
text/xml,application/xml,application/xhtml+xml,text/html;q=0.9,text/plain;q=0.8,video/x-mng,image/png,image/jpeg,image/gif;q=0.2,text/css,*/*;q=0.1
   Accept-Language: en-us, en;q=0.85, en-au;q=0.71, en-ca;q=0.57, en-gb;q=0.42,
pt;q=0.28, it;q=0.14
   Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, compress;q=0.9
   Accept-Charset: ISO-8859-1, utf-8;q=0.66, *;q=0.66
   Keep-Alive: 300
   Proxy-Connection: keep-alive
   Range: bytes=2233-
   If-Range: "2b221-647-6062b100"
   Cache-Control: max-age=0
Creating HtmlFilter for http://concept.ocis.temple.edu/nUtNIX/
   Content-Type: text/html; charset=iso-8859-1
   Proxy-Connection: close
   Content-Length: 1063
   Server: Apache/2.0.40 (Unix) mod_ssl/2.0.40 OpenSSL/0.9.6g
   Date: Wed, 16 Oct 2002 07:56:55 GMT
   Connection: close
===============================================================================

To answer the future question, same request when AdSubtract was turned off.

Have not been able to reproduce the problem with IE 5.5, so I guess it is a
client problem.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Now you need to compare the actual size of the file to what is requested
in the Range: header.  If the file is smaller than 2233 bytes, then Apache
is responding correctly and the problem is with the client.

creator: sbirl@temple.edu
text:
1607 bytes.  So it's a client problem.  I'll go inform Netscape.

Thanks for taking time to go through this, Joshua.
